definition: overnight/instantly/very quickly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dusk/evening/Taiwan pr. [xi4]
lit. one morning and one evening (idiom)/fig. in a short period of time/overnight
one scare after another (idiom)/in a constant state of tension

sentences.english: It's not going to happen overnight.
But no one became Roman overnight.
sentences.chinese: 但转化为罗马人绝非一夕之功。

sentences.english: After winning the lottery jackpot, he went from rags to riches overnight.
sentences.chinese: 赢了乐透头彩后，他一夕之间从一贫如洗变成富翁。

sentences.english: After days of hard work, he had a good night sleep at last.
sentences.chinese: 劳累多日，今天他终于得到了一夕安寝。

sentences.english: We've passed through a century during which many indigenous languages were wiped out or pushed to the brink of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 几世纪来，许多土语遭到抹杀或是一夕之间消失。

sentences.english: Just like personality molding, the brand image – building is not the matter of a single day.
sentences.chinese: 品牌塑造一如人格的塑造，非一朝一夕之功。

sentences.english: Overnight, the F is a sea change.
sentences.chinese: 一夕之间，己是沧海桑田。

sentences.english: In America, reputations come and go overnight and in the end usually does not matter.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，名誉一夕之间大起大落，最后不会那么重要。

sentences.english: Love is hard to get into, uggs on sale, but harder to get out of.
sentences.chinese: 爱很难投进，但一夕投进，即更易走没。

sentences.english: I do so recognising that change cannot happen overnight.
sentences.chinese: 我了解改变是不可能再一夕之间发生。

sentences.english: The beggar went from rags to riches overnight after winning the lottery.
sentences.chinese: 这个乞丐赢了乐透后，一夕之间从穷人变成富人。

sentences.english: Many pop bands nowadays make it big overnight.
sentences.chinese: 当今许多流行乐团在一夕之间成名。

sentences.english: The transition to low carbon energy can't just happen overnight.
sentences.chinese: 向低碳能源转变不会是一朝一夕的事。

sentences.english: It can take awhile to damage a strong brand.
sentences.chinese: 损害一个强大的品牌可能只需要一朝一夕。

sentences.english: Excuse me, can you please tell me where the closest toilet is located?
sentences.chinese: 低扰一夕，请问最近肉厕所守哪乏？

sentences.english: He burns at the centre of time, and he can see the turn of the universe.
sentences.chinese: 他在时间的中心燃烧，他能看到宇宙的一夕瞬变。

definition: morning and night/all the time
former times/olden days
at the present/now
a beautiful woman/young beauties/youths/rosy cheeks
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on
concern/wife and children
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
unexpectedly/to one's surprise
fantasy/illusion/dream
quiet, silent, and lonely/far and indistinct/gone without a trace
(of time) to pass/to die
lit. clouds scatter, wind flows (idiom); the crisis settles down/people disperse home/things return to normal
suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)
to meet in passing/to get on well at first meeting
(literary) far more than/not limited to
cold pillow and lonely bed (idiom); fig. cold and solitary existence
